Liverpool have found an unlikely ally in former England boss Sam Allardyce.

The ex-Bolton manager, who branded Jurgen Klopp "a soft German" back in 2015, insists the Reds boss was right to be furious with Sadio Mane's sending off in last weekend's 5-0 thrashing at Manchester City.

Liverpool have appealed against the length of Mane's three-match ban after he was dismissed by referee Jon Moss for catching City goalkeeper Ederson in the face with a high boot.

Speaking on Sky's Monday Night Football, Allardyce said: "Did he intend to injury him? He didn't.
"He's just going for the ball, he has to go for the ball and he can only go for it with his foot. He can't go with his head and he can't see the goalkeeper.

"Under the letter of the law, it's a red but I think that's wrong. I don't think someone should get sent off when he doesn't intend to injure the player.

å¤§Sam

Liverpool have found an unlikely ally in former England boss Sam Allardyce.

The ex-Bolton manager, who branded Jurgen Klopp "a soft German" back in 2015, insists the Reds boss was right to be furious with Sadio Mane's sending off in last weekend's 5-0 thrashing at Manchester City.

Liverpool have appealed against the length of Mane's three-match ban after he was dismissed by referee Jon Moss for catching City goalkeeper Ederson in the face with a high boot.

Speaking on Sky's Monday Night Football, Allardyce said: "Did he intend to injury him? He didn't.
"He's just going for the ball, he has to go for the ball and he can only go for it with his foot. He can't go with his head and he can't see the goalkeeper.

"Under the letter of the law, it's a red but I think that's wrong. I don't think someone should get sent off when he doesn't intend to injure the player.

å””è¨˜å¾—æ˜¯å’ªwerner

Forsberg?

ä¿‚
Forsberg, however, is quite happy where he is, and if he was to move to an English club, it would be to Liverpool.

“I’ll stay,” he told Bild [via Afton Bladet].

“Right now I can not think of a better club.

“Anything can happen in football but I have extended my contract with the club because I really like working in Leipzig.

“It makes my wife (happy) as well, which is most important.

“Leipzig felt right from the beginning and that is the important thing.”

He added, “In my childhood it was Liverpool because my dad was a big supporter. I slept in Liverpool bedding, but also Barcelona and Real Madrid.

“Today there are still teams I like more, but when you play for yourself, it’s usually your first club that is the favorite.”
